description.p: A scaling move draws a random uniform number u ~ unif(-0.5,0.5) and scales the current vale by a scaling factor sf = exp( lambda * u ) where lambda is the tuning parameter of the proposal to influence the size of the proposals.

constructor-help-entry.name: mvScale
constructor-help-entry.usage: mvScale( RealPos x, RealPos lambda = 1, Bool tune = TRUE, RealPos weight = 1 )

argument.label: x
argument.description: The random variable that will be scaled

argument.label: lambda
argument.description: The tuning parameter influence the amount of scaling.

argument.label: weight
argument.description: The expected number of times this move will be applied per iteration.

constructor-help-entry.example:
# Create a simple model (unclamped) a ~ exponential(1) mymodel = model(a)
# Create a move vector and a monitor vector moves[1] <- mScale(a, lambda=1.0, weight=1.0) monitors[1] <- mnModel("out.txt")
# Create an mcmc object mymcmcObject <- mcmc( mymodel, monitors, moves)
# Run a short analysis mymcmcObject.burnin( generations = 400, tuningInterval = 100) mymcmcObject.run( generations = 400)
# print the summary of the operators (now tuned) mymcmcObject.operatorSummary()
constructor-help-entry.author: Sebastian Hoehna
